1. # of Projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanisms. 2. Divergence between planned and actual disbursement. 3. Number of line ministries officials trained on fiduciary monitoring. 4. # of days needed to complete a transparent procurement process. 5. % of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time.

comment.narrative: 1. No project has embedded fiduciary monitoring mechanisms. 2. More than 20% divergence between the planned and actual disbursement. 3. Low national capacity to undertake fiduciary monitoring. 4. More than 210 days. 5. 50%.

1. 23 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, # of days needed to complete a transparent procurement process (Bid evaluation 90 days, contract negotiation 60 days), 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 2. 23 projects has fiduciary monitoring mechanism, Divergence between planned and actual disbursement of less than 20%, # of days needed to complete a transparent financial management process / LC issuance of 60 days, 90% of monthly monitoring reports using the accepted reporting standards submitted on time. 3. Establishing an annual capacity building plan for PMTs. 150 Iraqi official in charge of ODA loan projects trained(including 30 % of female officials)
